chapter.title: Sites and Services
chapter.para: Orc programs communicate with their environment by calling sites. These sites perform services, which the Orc program orchestrates. A site call may return a value, or may be silent, returning no value.
Orc has no built-in services, so even operations as simple as addition are performed by sites. Sites may also provide complex services, such as a database management system.
Sites may be provided by various types of software components, such as Java classes, Web services, or custom Orc sites. The site call interface, however, is uniform across these types.
